page.title: 09ROTHLEY CHURCHES UNITED
page.content: Christ has been worshipped in Rothley since Saxon times (see cross-shaft in churchyard).{The parish church of St. { Mary & St.John}is late Norman to 15th century,the{Methodist Chapel}in Howe Lane early 19th century;there are more recent{Baptist}and{Roman Catholic chapels.Around 9% of the population attends worship regularly.All the churches have classes for children,two have active youth fellowships,all have programmes of outreach and service to the community,e.g. the Baptist drop-in coffee facility for shoppers.The churches co-operate through the { Rothley Christian Council of Churches which organises or sponsors,e.g.: regular united services; a house-to- house collection and other events in { Christian Aid Week};a joint monthly Men's Fellowship and an annual{Feast { Day Procession of Witness.
